html:
• English (Default)
  • Spanish

Dear John,

Here's an important tip about buying a house: most real estate agents won't even submit your offer unless you've been pre-approved. That's right – you could be willing to pay the listing price, but if you haven't spoken to a mortgage professional and made sure you can qualify for financing, real estate agents won't want to present your offer to the seller. They don't want to waste the time and take the house off the market only to find out you couldn't get approved.

Make sure your offer has a fair chance by being pre-approved for financing first. Don't let this simple step stand in the way of you buying your dream home.

If you'd like to get pre-approved before you make an offer on a house, you can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

David Young

Estimado John,

Aquí está un tip importante sobre comprar una casa; la mayoría de los agentes ni siquiera envían su oferta a menos de que haya sido pre-aprobado. Así es - usted podría estar dispuesto a pagar el precio de venta, pero si no ha hablado con un profesional de hipoteca y se ha asegurado de que califica para financiamiento, los agentes no quieren presentar su oferta al vendedor. No quieren perder su dinero y tener la casa fuera del mercado sólo para enterarse de que no pudo ser aprobado.

Asegúrese que su oferta tiene una buena probabilidad de ser pre-aprobado para un financiamiento primero. No deje que este simple paso esté en su camino de comprar la casa de sus sueños.

Si quiere ser pre-aprobado antes de hacer una oferta en una casa, puede llamarme al 310-954-7772 o responder a este correo.

Dear John,

How many houses have you seen so far? Are they all starting to blur together? Or have you seen more than one house where you love the kitchen but the house is on a busy road. Another house is on a quiet cul-de-sac but the kitchen is old and needs to be gutted. You wish you could mix the best parts of all the houses into one dream house.

That's kind of how it is with borrowers. Not everyone is strong in terms of income, assets, and credit. Every so often, a borrower will have excellent credit but their income is too low to qualify for the loan they want. Or a borrower might have high income, but thin or bad credit.

That's where I come in. I can analyze your income, assets, and credit, and help you find a loan program where your specific credit profile will be approved. And I am always mindful of this important goal: getting you the best rate possible.

I hope you find the house that meets all your needs. But no matter what house you choose, I will help you get your best mortgage. Please contact me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

David Young

Estimado John,

¿Cuántas casas ya ha visto? ¿Todas se ven igual para ahora? O ha sido más de una casa donde le encanta la cocina, pero la casa está en una calle con mucho tráfico. Otra casa que está en un lugar tranquilo pero la cocina es vieja y necesita ser remodelada. Desearía mezclar ambas de las mejores partes de todas las casas en una casa de ensueño.

Así es como es con los deudores. No todos tienen un fuerte en términos de ingreso, activos financieros y crédito. De vez en cuando, un deudor tendrá excelente historial crediticio pero su ingreso es muy bajo para calificar para el préstamo que quieren. O un deudor puede tener alto ingreso pero muy delgado o mal historial crediticio.

Ahí es donde entro yo. Puedo analizar su ingreso, activos y crédito, y ayudarlo a encontrar un programa de préstamos donde su perfil crediticio específico sea aprobado. Y yo siempre tengo en cuenta la meta importante; obtener la mejor tasa posible para usted.

Espero encuentre una casa que cumpla con todas  sus necesidades. Pero no importa qué casa elija, espero poder ayudarlo a encontrar la mejor hipoteca. Por llame al 310-954-7772 o responda a este correo.

David Young

campaign: CE: Application Purchase Home Search Follow Up - Client
html:
• English (Default)
  • Spanish

Dear John,

Let's say you find a house and the seller wants to close quickly. You fill out a loan application but it takes forever to be approved. Why? Because you can't find the documents your bank needs.

Here's a tip on how to get approved quickly: make sure you have the documents you'll need.

What documents are required? Typically, banks need to see two years of income documents (tax returns if you're self-employed, W2s if you're salaried); 2 recent pay stubs; and 2 months of recent consecutive bank statements from any accounts you'll be using for down payment and closing costs.

If you can't find last year's W2 because you moved a few times and changed accountants, you'll have to request it from that employer, which takes time. 

You might also be missing certain bank statements, especially if the down payment is coming from multiple accounts.

The longer it takes you to get key documents, the longer it will take you to get approved. And the longer it takes you to get approved, the longer it takes to close.

Even after you put this file together, keep saving these documents until you close. You will be required to provide a current pay stub and bank statement prior to closing. 

If you have any questions on what documents you'll need to get approved, you can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

David Young
CMO / Partner
Business Development & Strategic Growth
NMLS: 62043 | DRE: 01371572

Estimado John,

Digamos que el vendedor quiere cerrar rápidamente. Usted llena la aplicación del préstamo pero toma mucho tiempo ser aprobado. ¿Por qué? Porque no puede encontrar los documentos que su banco necesita.

Aquí hay un tip en cómo ser aprobado rápidamente: asegúrese de tener los documentos que necesitará.

¿Qué documentos son necesarios? Usualmente, el banco necesita ver dos años de documentos de ingresos (declaración fiscal si es trabajador independiente, W2s si es asalariado); 2 comprobantes de pago recientes; y 2 meses de estados de cuenta de bancos de cualquier cuenta que estará usando para el anticipo y costos de cierre.

Si no puede encontrar su W2 del año pasado porque se mudó algunas veces y cambió de contador, tendrá que pedirlo a su empleador, lo cual toma tiempo.

Puede que tampoco tenga algunos estados de cuenta de banco, especialmente si el anticipo lo hará desde múltiples cuentas.

Mientras más tiempo le tome obtener los documentos clave, más tiempo le tomará en obtener su aprobación. Y mientras más tiempo tarde en ser aprobado, más tiempo tarda en cerrar.

Incluso cuando tenga estos documentos juntos, sígalos guardando hasta el cierre. Usted requerirá proveer un comprobante de pago reciente y un estado de cuenta del banco antes del cierre.

Si tiene alguna pregunta en qué documentos necesita para ser aprobado, puede llamarme al 310-954-7772 o responda a este correo.

Dear John,

Here's an important tip about buying a house: most realtors won't even submit your offer unless you've been pre-approved. That's right – you could be willing to pay the listing price, but if you haven't spoken to a mortgage professional and made sure you can qualify for financing, realtors don't want to present your offer to the seller. They don't want to waste the time and take the house off the market only to find out you couldn't get approved.

Make sure your offer has a fair chance by being pre-approved for financing first. Don't let this simple step stand in the way of you buying your dream home.

If you'd like to get pre-approved before you make an offer on a house, you can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

This email was just sent to John

 

Dear John,

Let's say you find a house and the seller wants to close quickly. You fill out a loan application but it takes forever to be approved. Why? Because you can't find the documents your bank needs.

Here's a tip on how to get approved quickly: make sure you have the documents you'll need.

What documents are required? Typically, banks need to see two years of income documents (tax returns if you're self-employed, W2s if you're salaried); 2 recent pay stubs; and 2 months of recent consecutive bank statements from any accounts you'll be using for down payment and closing costs.

If you can't find last year's W2 because you moved a few times and changed accountants, you'll have to request it from that employer, which takes time. 

You might also be missing certain bank statements, especially if the down payment is coming from multiple accounts.

The longer it takes you to get key documents, the longer it will take you to get approved. And the longer it takes you to get approved, the longer it takes to close.

Even after you put this file together, keep saving these documents until you close. You will be required to provide a current pay stub and bank statement prior to closing. 

If you have any questions on what documents you'll need to get approved, you 

can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

David Young

This email was just sent to John

Dear John,

I don't know if you've been through the bidding process yet, but I wanted to share some important information with you about making an offer that will be accepted.

Let's say you find a house you like. You do your research on similar homes that have sold in the area, and you talk to your realtor, who tells you the house is fairly priced. You make an offer at the listing price. 

Your realtor tells you your bid was rejected. They went with another offer. She finds out that the other party bid the same exact price as you did. Why did they go with the other offer?

Because your offer said you needed to sell your current house before you bought the new house. You needed to get the money from your sale in order to put down 20% on the new house.

Most sellers don't want their sale contingent on you selling your house. Too many things can come up that would cause delays or even make you unable to close.

So what do you do? You find out if you qualify without selling first. There are some programs that will let you buy with just 5% down. Or you might be able to rent out your current house to offset the carrying costs. If you can carry both homes for a short period of time, you may qualify to buy without selling.

Then you'd be able to put in an offer without a condition that you sell your current home. 

If you'd like to find out about qualifying to buy a house when you still need to sell your current home, you can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

David Young

Estimado John,

No sé si ya ha pasado por el proceso de ofertar, pero quería compartir alguna información importante con usted sobre hacer una oferta que será aceptada.

Digamos que encuentra una casa que le gusta. Investiga sobre otras casas similares que se han vendido en el área y habla con su agente, quien le dice que la casa tiene un buen precio. Usted hace una oferta al precio de venta.

Su agente le informa que su oferta fue rechazada. Aceptaron otra oferta. Ella se entera que la otra persona ofertó exactamente el mismo precio que usted. ¿Por qué aceptaron la otra oferta?

Porque su oferta decía que necesitaba vender su casa actual antes de comprar su nueva casa. Necesitaba obtener el dinero de su venta para poder poner el anticipo de 20% en su nueva casa.

La mayoría de los  vendedores no quieren depender de que usted venda su casa. Muchas cosas pueden salir mal que pueden causar retrasos o incluso que no sea capaz de cerrar el trato.

¿Qué debe hacer? Usted investiga si califica sin tener que vender primero. Hay algunos programas que le dejarán comprar con tan sólo 5% de anticipo. O tal vez pueda rentar su casa actual para disminuir los gastos. Si puede mantener ambas casas por un corto periodo de tiempo, puede calificar para comprar sin vender.

Entonces sería capaz de poner una oferta sin condiciones de vender su casa actual.

Si quiere saber si califica para comprar una casa cuando usted tiene que vender su casa actual, puede llamarme al 310-954-7772 o responda a este correo.

David Young

Dear John,

Did we talk about the 2% rule for refinancing? Years ago, people said it only made sense to refinance if your new rate was at least 2% below the rate on your current mortgage. Well, times have changed. It may even make sense to refinance if you can get 1% or more below the rate you're paying right now. It all depends on your holding period and closing costs to refinance. 

Please contact me at 310-954-7772 or simply reply to this email.

Dear John,

Does it make sense to refinance?

Only you can answer that, but I can help you with the numbers part. Many people have a certain number in their head that they want to save by refinancing. Some people have a target dollar amount they want to walk away with. Everyone's different. I can do some calculations for you and tell you what your new payment will be and how much you'll save.

Dear John,

You've found a house. The seller has accepted your offer. What happens now?

At this point, the realtor or attorneys will draw up a contract for you to look over and sign. A lot of the information in a standard residential contract is boilerplate, but there are a few key sections you should pay attention to.

The most important one is the mortgage contingency clause. What this means is you have an out if you don't get approved. The majority of contracts ask you to make a deposit when you sign. This deposit can be an amount up to 10% of the purchase price of the house. That's a lot of money!

But if you have a mortgage contingency clause, it protects you from losing your deposit if you don't get approved. The clause will specify the mortgage you are seeking. If you don't get approved for that amount, you have the ability to get out of the contract and get your money back.

If you have any questions about your ability to be approved, please contact me at 310-954-7772 or reply to this email.

David Young

Estimado John,

Ha encontrado una casa. El vendedor ha aceptado su oferta. ¿Qué pasa ahora?

En este punto, el asesor de bienes raíces o abogado hará un contrato para usted para revisarlo y firmar. Mucha información en un contrato residencial estándar es repetitiva, pero hay algunas secciones clave a las cuales debería poner atención.

La más importante es la cláusula de contingencia de hipoteca. Esto significa que si usted no es aprobado, tiene una salida. La mayoría de los contratos piden hacer un depósito cuando firma. Este depósito puede ser una cantidad hasta 10% del porcentaje de precio de la casa. ¡Eso es mucho dinero!

Pero si tiene una cláusula de contingencia de hipoteca, lo protege de perder su depósito si es que no es aprobado. La cláusula especificará la hipoteca que está buscando. Si no lo aprueban para esa cantidad, tiene la habilidad de salir del contrato y obtener su dinero de vuelta.

Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre su habilidad de ser aprobado, por favor llámeme al 310-954-7772 o responda a este correo.

Dear John,

What if you went through the pre-approval process with one lender but ended up applying with another? Will you still be approved for the same loan amount?

Chances are, yes, but you should make sure you know how much mortgage (and house) you can afford. Don't wait until the last minute and end up calling every bank in town. You're probably ok with the first bank's pre-approval, but some loan officers are not as careful as others. 

I can make sure the first time that you get pre-approved for the most you can qualify for.

Your situation is unique, and you need an approach that is tailored to you. Sure, you can always plug some numbers into an online calculator, but that isn't the same as talking to an experienced loan officer who can read between the lines and figure out exactly how much you can borrow.

If you have any questions about how much you qualify for, please contact me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

Estimado John,

¿Qué pasa si pasó por el proceso de pre-aprobación con un prestador pero terminó aplicando con otro? ¿Será aprobado para la misma cantidad de préstamo?

Es probable que sí, pero usted debería asegurarse de saber cuánta hipoteca (y casa) puede pagar. No espere hasta el último minuto y termine llamando a todos los bancos de la ciudad. Probablemente esté de acuerdo con la pre-aprobación del primer banco, pero algunos oficiales de préstamos no son tan cuidadosos como otros.

Yo puedo asegurarme que la primera vez que sea pre-aprobado sea por la mayor cantidad para la que califica.

Su situación es única, y necesita un planteamiento hecho para usted. Claro, siempre puede poner algunos números en una calculadora en línea, pero no es lo mismo a hablar con un oficial de préstamos experimentado que puede leer entre líneas y saber exáctamente cuánto puede tomar prestado.

Dear John,

Here's another tip about the purchase contract. It usually specifies some key dates that you must abide by. One date is the mortgage commitment date. This means you are agreeing to get approved by that date. If you don't, people start getting nervous. Sometimes, sellers have been known to threaten to kill the contract. But most people will give you at least one extension. Why put yourself in that position? Get approved quickly by being ready.

The next important date is the closing date. That's when you sign a bunch of loan documents and your mortgage money is wired to the closing agent so you can buy the house. Normally the closing date can be extended if necessary, but most sellers don't want to extend more than once.

Occasionally, a seller will want a delayed closing (perhaps they have kids in school and they want to finish out the school year in their old house). 

Just make sure before you sign the contract you are aware of the dates in the contract and have a good idea of your ability to meet those deadlines.

If you want to make sure you can get approved in time, please contact me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

Estimado John,

Aquí hay otro tip acerca del contrato de compra. Usualmente especifica algunas fechas importantes a las que debe cumplir. Una fecha es la fecha de compromiso de hipoteca. Esto significa que usted está aceptando a ser aprobado para esa fecha. Si no lo hace, la gente empieza a ponerse nerviosa. Algunas veces, los vendedores han sido conocidos por cancelar el contrato. Pero la mayoría de la gente le dará por lo menos una extensión. ¿Por qué ponerse en esa posición? Obtenga aprobación rápidamente estando listo.

La siguiente fecha importante es la fecha de cierre. Ahí es cuando firma un montón de documentos del préstamo y su dinero de hipoteca es transferido al agente de cierre para que pueda comprar la casa. Normalmente, la fecha de cierre puede ser extendida si es necesario, pero la mayoría de los vendedores no quieren extenderla más de una vez.

Ocasionalmente, el vendedor querrá un cierre tardío (tal vez tienen niños en la  escuela y quieren terminar el año escolar en su vieja casa).

Sólo asegúrese antes de que firme el contrato de que está al tanto de las fechas en el contrato y tiene una buena idea de su habilidad de cumplir el plazo.

Si quiere asegurarse de que puede ser aprobado en tiempo, por favor llámeme al 310-954-7772 o responda a este correo.

Dear John,

You've found a house. The seller has accepted your offer. What happens now?

At this point, the realtor or attorneys will draw up a contract for you to look over and sign. A lot of the information in a standard residential contract is boilerplate, but there are a few key sections you should pay attention to.

The most important one is the mortgage contingency clause. What this means is you have an out if you don't get approved. The majority of contracts ask you to make a deposit when you sign. This deposit can be an amount up to 10% of the purchase price of the house. That's a lot of money!

But if you have a mortgage contingency clause, it protects you from losing your deposit if you don't get approved. The clause will specify the mortgage you are seeking. If you don't get approved for that amount, you have the ability to get out of the contract and get your money back.

If you have any questions about your ability to be approved, please contact me at 310-954-7772 or by repling to this email.

This email was just sent to John

Dear John,

Let's say the seller wants to close quickly. You fill out a loan application but it takes forever to be approved. Why? Because you can't find the documents your bank needs.

Here's a tip on how to get approved quickly: make sure you have the documents you'll need.

What documents are required? Typically, banks need to see two years of income documents (tax returns if you're self-employed, W2s if you're salaried); 2 recent pay stubs; and 2 months of recent consecutive bank statements from any accounts you'll be using for down payment and closing costs.

If you can't find last year's W2 because you moved a few times and changed accountants, you'll have to request it from that employer, which takes time. 

You might also be missing certain bank statements, especially if the down payment is coming from multiple accounts.

The longer it takes you to get key documents, the longer it will take you to get approved. And the longer it takes you to get approved, the longer it takes to close.

Even after you put this file together, keep saving these documents until you close. You will be required to provide a current pay stub and bank statement prior to closing. 

If you have any questions on what documents you'll need to get approved, you 

can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

Estimado John,

Digamos que el vendedor quiere cerrar rápidamente. Usted llena la aplicación del préstamo pero toma mucho tiempo ser aprobado. ¿Por qué? Porque no puede encontrar los documentos que su banco necesita.

Aquí hay un tip en cómo ser aprobado rápidamente: asegúrese de tener los documentos que necesitará.

¿Qué documentos son necesarios? Usualmente, el banco necesita ver dos años de documentos de ingresos (declaración fiscal si es trabajador independiente, W2s si es asalariado); 2 comprobantes de pago recientes; y 2 meses de estados de cuenta de bancos de cualquier cuenta que estará usando para el anticipo y costos de cierre.

Si no puede encontrar su W2 del año pasado porque se mudó algunas veces y cambió de contador, tendrá que pedirlo a su empleador, lo cual toma tiempo.

Puede que tampoco tenga algunos estados de cuenta de banco, especialmente si el anticipo lo hará desde múltiples cuentas.

Mientras más tiempo le tome obtener los documentos clave, más tiempo le tomará en obtener su aprobación. Y mientras más tiempo tarde en ser aprobado, más tiempo tarda en cerrar.

Incluso cuando tenga estos documentos juntos, sígalos guardando hasta el cierre. Usted requerirá proveer un comprobante de pago reciente y un estado de cuenta del banco antes del cierre.

 

Si tiene alguna pregunta en qué documentos necesita para ser aprobado, puede llamarme al 310-954-7772 o responda a este correo.

Dear John,

Have you had your home inspection done yet? Most people get it done after their offer is accepted but before they put down their contract deposit. 

Why? Let's say the engineer does the inspection and determines that you'll need to replace the roof in the next three years. You didn't count on that expense. Had you known that, you might have bid less for the house. Armed with this information before you sign the contract, you might be able to get the seller to reduce the price slightly.

Sometimes, the home inspection will kill the deal, especially if they find evidence of high levels of radon or termite infestation. Some problems are so expensive to cure it might make you reconsider buying the house.

If you have any questions about what else can come up in a home inspection, please contact me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

Dear John,

It has been three days since you first inquired about a mortgage with me and I wanted to take a brief moment to share some important tips with you about getting the best mortgage for your needs.

First of all, as we begin the loan process it is important that you do not make any large purchases. Putting a large balance on your credit card or opening a new line of credit can have a negative impact on your credit score and affect your rate. Additionally, do not make any large cash purchases that will reduce the amount of your bank account. If you must make a large purchase or move money, please contact me first and we can discuss the best way to do it.

Also, to maintain your credit score it is also important to continue to pay all of your bills on time. Having a recent late on your credit score can also lower your credit score and affect the rate you can qualify for.

Finally, I am sure that you see advertisements for different mortgages on a daily basis. These advertisements often show a low payment or rate on a mortgage. While these types of loans do exist, they often only have that sort of rate for a short time before increasing. Keep in mind that if something sounds too good to be true, then it probably is. As a mortgage professional, I work with my clients to help them find the best rate and program for their financial situation and I will thoroughly explain the programs and rates that I recommend.

If you have any questions at this time, please contact me at 310-954-7772 so that we can make sure this process run as smoothly as possible.

David Young

John,

Han pasado tres días desde la primera vez que me pregunto en cuanto a una hipoteca, y quise tomar un breve momento para compartir algunos consejos para conseguir la mejor hipoteca para sus necesidades.

Primeramente, al empezar el proceso de préstamo es importante que no haga alguna gran compra. Poniendo un alto balance en su tarjeta de crédito o abrir una line de crédito le puede impactar negativamente a su puntaje crediticio y afectar su tasa de interés. Además, no haga alguna gran compra en efectivo que reduzca la cantidad de su cuenta bancaria.  Si tiene que hacer una gran compra o mudar dinero, favor de contactarnos de antemano, y platicaremos sobre la mejor manera de hacerlo.

También, para mantener su puntaje crediticio es importante que siga pagando sus facturas a tiempo. Tener un pago tarde reciente le puede bajar su puntaje crediticio y afectar la tasa de interés por la cual cualifica.

Finalmente, de seguro ha visto anuncios para diferentes hipotecas a diario.  Estos anuncios a menudo enseñan un bajo pago o tasa de interés de hipoteca. Aunque estos préstamos si existen, con frecuencia sólo tienen ese tipo de tasa de interés por un corto plazo antes de aumentar.  Ten en mente que si algo suena demasiado bueno para ser verdad, entonces probablemente lo sea. Como profesional hipotecario, trabajo con mis clientes para ayudar a encontrarles la mejor tasa y el mejor programa para su situación financiera y explicare a fondo los programas y las tarifas que recomiendo.

Si tiene alguna pregunta por el momento, me puede conseguir al 310-954-7772 para asegurarnos que el proceso tenga menos complicaciones.

David Young

Dear John,

I  wanted to take a moment to follow up and see if you were still interested in a mortgage.

I also wanted to take this opportunity to share with you the importance of working with a mortgage professional. Most consumers feel that the rate is the most important factor in getting a mortgage, but the truth is that you really have to look at the entire loan program before going with any mortgage.

For example, an adjustable rate mortgage (ARM) offers a lower introductory rate, but this rate is only fixed for a specified period of time. After that, the rate will adjust according to the economic index the loan is tied to. While an ARM can be a great loan for some homeowners, it can also be a negative for others if the homeowner is not able to refinance after the fixed period ends.

Because there are so many different types of loans and subtleties to consider, it's important to make sure that you understand the loan before deciding to go with it. That's why I pledge to always provide superior service by:

  • Maintaining constant communication so you know what is happening with your loan
  • Shopping each loan to find the best loan program for your needs
  • Explaining the details of each loan program
  • Offering competitive fees and closing costs
  • Monitoring your loan after it closes for

If you have any questions or are ready to start the loan process, please contact me and I will be happy to help you.

David Young

John,

Quise tomar un momento para contactarte y ver si todavia le interesa una hipoteca.  

También quise tomar esta oportunidad para compartir con usted la importancia de trabajar con un hipotecario profesional.  La mayoría de los consumidores sienten que la tasa de interés es el factor más importante en conseguir una hipoteca, pero en verdad debe mirar al programa entero de préstamo antes de ir con cualquier préstamo.  

Por ejemplo, una hipoteca de tasa ajustable (ARM) ofrece una baja tasa de introducción, pero esta tasa es fijo solo por un corto plazo específico.  Después de eso, la tasa se ajusta de acuerdo a el índice económico a la cual está vinculada. Mientras que una hipoteca ajustable pueda ser un gran préstamo para algunos dueños de casa, también le pueda ser negativo para otros si el dueño no es capaz de refinanciar después de que termine el plazo fijo.  

Porque hay tantos diferentes tipos de préstamos y sutilezas que considerar, es importante asegurarse que usted entienda el préstamo antes de decidir ir con el.  Por eso yo me comprometo a siempre proveer un servicio superior mediante:

  • Mantener constante comunicación para que usted sepa lo que pasa con su préstamo
  • Investigar cada préstamo para encontrar el mejor préstamo para sus necesidades.
  • Explicar los detalles de cada programa de préstamo
  • Ofrecer tarifas y gastos de cierre competitivos
  • Vigilar su préstamo después del cierre

Si tiene cualquier pregunta o si desea empezar el proceso de préstamo, favor de contactarme  y con mucho gusto le ayudare.

David Young

Dear John and Doe,

Before you can make an offer on a new home, it is important to first get a pre-approval letter. A pre-approval letter lets the seller of a home know that you are able to qualify for financing on the particular home. Unlike a letter of prequalification, the pre-approval is based on an analysis of your credit and gives a true estimate of whether you can qualify for a mortgage as well as how much you can qualify for. Even if you have not yet decided on a particular home, getting pre-approved early, will also allow you to inspect your credit report and uncover any mistakes or issues that you may not be aware of.

This letter is issued by a mortgage professional.  While any mortgage institution can issue this type of letter for you, I recommend that you contact David Young, my preferred mortgage professional. David Young can be reached at any time either by phone at 310-954-7772 or email at david@lendwisemtg.com.

Once again, if you have any questions or would like to start looking for a home, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Best regards,

John and Doe,

Antes de poder hacer una oferta para una nueva casa, es importante conseguir primero una carta de preaprobacion. Una pre aprobación le deja saber al vendedor de la casa que usted es capaz de calificar para financiamiento para la casa en particular. Diferente a una carta de precalificación, la pre - aprobación está basada en el análisis de su crédito y da un verdadero estimado en cuanto a si usted pueda calificar para una hipoteca tanto como por cual cantidad califica. Aunque usted no se haya decidido en una casa en particular, siendo pre-aprobado temprano en el proceso le permitirá inspeccionar su reporte de crédito y descubrir cualquier error o asunto de la cual usted no estaba al tanto.

Esta carta es emitida por un profesional hipotecario y mientras cualquier institución hipotecaria puede emitir este tipo de carta por usted, recomiendo que contacte a David Young, mi profesional hipotecario de preferencia. Puede conseguir a David Young a cualquier hora tanto por teléfono al 310-954-7772 o mediante correo electronico al david@lendwisemtg.com.

Nuevamente, si tiene cualquier pregunta o si desea empezar a buscar una casa, favor de contactarme.

Dear John and Doe,

As you begin the home buying process, it is important to remember that you should not do anything right now that can negatively impact your credit score. Even if you are currently pre-approved, a sudden change in your credit score can jeopardize your chances of obtaining a mortgage.

Even though there are a lot of costs associated with moving, it is important that you continue to pay your bills on time and refrain from making any large purchases. Running up credit cards or opening new lines of credit can negatively impact your credit score, so try avoid making any large purchased at this time.

If you do need to open a new line of credit, make a large purchase, or transfer a large amount to/from your bank account, please ask David Young or your mortgage consultant before doing so.

Also, if you have any questions about purchasing your new home, remember that I am here to help you.

Best regards,

Dear John and Doe,

When purchasing a home, it is important to hire a qualified home inspector to make sure the house you want to purchase is in good shape. A thorough home inspection will not only identify potential problems, but it will give you a chance to negotiate the repairs on the home prior to closing. An inspection is different from an appraisal, so it is also important that you do not get the two confused. While the appraisal is used by the lender to make sure that the amount of your mortgage is in line with the value of the home, the inspection is a chance for you to make sure that you are aware of any repairs that need to be made to the home you are about to purchase.

The inspection checklist should cover detailed questions about the drainage, foundation, roof, interior & exterior paint, plumbing, wiring, heating, fireplace, tile, termite report, and hazards.

If you have any questions about getting a home inspection or need help finding a qualified home inspector, please let me know and I will be happy to recommend one for you.

Best regards,

 

�

John and Doe,

Cuando compra una casa, es importante contratar a un inspector de casa calificado para asegurarse que la casa que quiere comprar este en buenas condiciones. Una inspección completa no solo identifica problemas potenciales, pero le dará una oportunidad para negociar las reparaciones de la casa antes de el cierre. Una inspección es distinta de una tasación, así que es importante no confundir los dos términos. Mientras que la tasación es usada por el Banco para asegurar que la cantidad de su hipoteca está en línea con el valor de la casa, la inspección le da la oportunidad a usted de asegurarse que está al corriente de cualquier reparación que necesita la casa que está a punto de comprar.

La lista de inspección debe cubrir preguntas detalladas sobre el drenaje, fundación, techo, pintura de interior y exterior, plomería, cableado eléctrico, calefacción, chimenea, baldosas/azulejos, reporte de termitas, y peligros.

Si tiene cualquier pregunta sobre conseguir una inspección de casa, o necesita ayuda encontrando un inspector de casa calificado, favor de dejarme saber, y con mucho gusto le recomendare uno.

�

Dear John,

It has been a few days since you were referred to me and I wanted to take a brief moment to share some important tips with you about getting the best mortgage for your needs.

First of all, as we begin the loan process it is important that you do not make any large purchases. Putting a large balance on your credit card or opening a new line of credit can have a negative impact on your credit score and affect your rate. Additionally, do not make any large cash purchases that will reduce the amount of your bank account. If you must make a large purchase or move money, please contact me first and we can discuss the best way to do it.

Also, to maintain your credit score it is also important to continue to pay all of your bills on time. Having a recent late on your credit score can also lower your credit score and affect the rate you can qualify for.

Finally, I am sure that you see advertisements for different mortgages on a daily basis. These advertisements often show a low payment or rate on a mortgage. While these types of loans do exist, they often only have that sort of rate for a short time before increasing. Keep in mind that if something sounds too good to be true, then it probably is. As a mortgage professional, I work with my clients to help them find the best rate and program for their financial situation and I will thoroughly explain the programs and rates that I recommend.

If you have any questions at this time, please contact me at 310-954-7772 so that we can make this process run as smoothly as possible.

 

David Young

John,

Ya hace unos cuantos días desde que usted me fue referido y quise tomar un momento breve para compartir algunos consejos importantes con usted en cuanto a conseguir la mejor hipoteca para sus necesidades.  Primeramente, al empezar el proceso de préstamo, es importante no hacer una gran compra. Acumulando un balance alto en su tarjeta de crédito o abrir una nueva línea de crédito le puede impactar negativamente a su puntaje crediticio y afectar su tasa de interés. Además, no haga alguna gran compra en efectivo que pueda reducir la cantidad en su cuenta bancaria. Si tiene que hacer una gran compra, o mudar dinero, favor de contactarnos de antemano y podemos hablar sobre la mejor manera de hacerlo.

También, para mantener su puntaje crediticio es importante continuar pagando sus facturas a tiempo. El tener un pago tarde reciente en su reporte de crédito le puede reducir su puntaje crediticio y afectar la tasa de interés por la cual pueda calificar.

Finalmente, de seguro ha visto anuncios para diferentes hipotecas a diario. Estos anuncios a menudo enseñan un bajo pago o tasa de interés de hipoteca. Aunque estos préstamos si existen, con frecuencia sólo tienen ese tipo de tasa de interés por un corto plazo antes de aumentar.  Ten en mente que si algo suena demasiado bueno para ser verdad, entonces probablemente lo sea. Como profesional hipotecario, trabajo con mis clientes para ayudar a encontrarles la mejor tasa y el mejor programa para su situación financiera y explicare a fondo los programas y las tarifas que recomiendo.  

Si tiene alguna pregunta por el momento, me puede conseguir al 310-954-7772 para asegurarnos que el proceso tenga menos complicaciones.

David Young

html:
• English (Default)
  • Spanish

Dear John,

I wanted to take a moment to follow up with you because I have not heard from you recently and wanted to know if you were still interested in a mortgage.

I also wanted to take this opportunity to share with you the importance of working with a mortgage professional. Most consumers feel that the rate is the most important factor in getting a mortgage, but the truth is that you really have to look at the entire loan program before going with any mortgage.

For example, an adjustable rate mortgage (ARM) offers a lower introductory rate, but this rate is only fixed for a specified period of time. After that, the rate will adjust according to the economic index the loan is tied to. While an ARM can be a great loan for some homeowners, it can also be a negative for others if the homeowner is not able to refinance after the fixed period ends.

Because there are so many different types of loans and subtleties to consider, it's important to make sure that you understand the loan before deciding to go with it. That's why I pledge to always provide superior service by:

  • Maintaining constant communication so you know what is happening with your loan
  • Shopping each loan to find the best loan program for your needs
  • Explaining the details of each loan program
  • Offering competitive fees and closing costs
  • Monitoring your loan after it closes for

If you have any questions or are ready to start the loan process, please contact me and I will be happy to help you.

David Young

John,

Quise tomar un momento para contactarte y ver si todavia le interesa una hipoteca.  

También quise tomar esta oportunidad para compartir con usted la importancia de trabajar con un hipotecario profesional. La mayoría de los consumidores sienten que la tasa de interés es el factor más importante en conseguir una hipoteca, pero en verdad debe mirar al programa entero de préstamo antes de ir con cualquier préstamo.  

Por ejemplo, una hipoteca de tasa ajustable (ARM) ofrece una baja tasa de introducción, pero esta tasa es fijo solo por un corto plazo específico. Después de eso, la tasa se ajusta de acuerdo a el índice económico a la cual está vinculada. Mientras que una hipoteca ajustable pueda ser un gran préstamo para algunos dueños de casa, también le pueda ser negativo para otros si el dueño no es capaz de refinanciar después de que termine el plazo fijo.  

Porque hay tantos diferentes tipos de préstamos y sutilezas que considerar, es importante asegurarse que usted entienda el préstamo antes de decidir ir con el. Por eso yo me comprometo a siempre proveer un servicio superior mediante:

  • Mantener constante comunicación para que usted sepa lo que pasa con su préstamo
  • Investigar cada préstamo para encontrar el mejor préstamo para sus necesidades.
  • Explicar los detalles de cada programa de préstamo
  • Ofrecer tarifas y gastos de cierre competitivos
  • Vigilar su préstamo después del cierre

Si tiene cualquier pregunta o si desea empezar el proceso de préstamo, favor de contactarme y con mucho gusto le ayudare.

campaign: CE: First Time Home Buyers - Mortgage Process
html:
• English (Default)
  • Spanish

Dear John and Doe,

To get a quick idea of what you can afford to spend, multiply your annual gross income (before taxes) by 3. For example, if your annual household income is $50,000, you might be able to qualify for a $150,000 home. This is just a rough estimate - the actual number will vary based on factors such as your debt and credit history.

Mortgage lenders typically use the housing expense and debt-to-income ratios to more accurately determine how much you can afford to spend on your mortgage.

Housing Expense Ratio
Mortgage lenders recommend that your monthly mortgage payment should be less than or equal to a quarter of your monthly gross income. This percentage can change based on the type of mortgage you choose and sometimes the area in which you're looking to buy.

Debt-to-Income Ratio
You need to factor your other debts into determining an affordable monthly mortgage payment. Mortgage lenders look at whether your total debt is larger than 30-40% of your monthly gross income. Remember, debt is not just credit cards and student loans. It can also include alimony, child support, car loans, and housing expenses.

If you haven't done so, please contact our office to get a definitive estimate of what you qualify for!

Sincerely,

Estimado John and Doe,

Para darle una idea rápida de cuánto puede gastar, multiplique su ingreso anual total (antes de pagar impuestos) por 3. Por ejemplo, si su ingreso anual del hogar es de $50,000, usted puede calificar para un hogar de $150,000. Este es un estimado bruto – el número exacto estará basado en distintos factores como su deuda y su historial crediticio. 

Prestamistas Hipotecarios usualmente usan los gastos de hogar y la relación deuda-ingreso para determinar más adecuadamente cuánto puede pagar en su hipoteca.

Tasa de Gastos de Vivienda
Prestamistas Hipotecarios recomiendan que su pago mensual de hipoteca debe ser menos o igual a un cuarto de su ingreso total mensual. Este porcentaje puede cambiar basado en el tipo de hipoteca que elija y algunas veces en el área en la que busca comprar.

Relación deuda-ingreso
Usted debe tomar en cuenta sus otras deudas para determinar un pago asequible de hipoteca. Prestamistas Hipotecarios revisan si su deuda total es más grande del 30-40% de su ingreso total mensual. Recuerde, la deuda no es sólo tarjetas de crédito y préstamos de estudiante. También puede incluir pensión alimenticia, manutención infantil, préstamos de automóvil y otros gastos del hogar.

Si no lo ha hecho, ¡por favor contacte nuestra oficina para obtener un estimado definitivo para el que califica!

Saludos cordiales,

John and Doe,

Using a real estate broker is a very good idea. All the details involved in home buying, particularly the financial ones, can be mind-boggling.

A good real estate professional can guide you through the entire process and make the experience much easier. A real estate broker will be well-acquainted with all the important things you'll want to know about a neighborhood you may be considering...the quality of schools, the number of children in the area, the safety of the neighborhood, traffic volume, and more.

He or she will help you figure the price range you can afford and search the classified ads and multiple listing services for homes you'll want to see. With immediate access to homes as soon as they're put on the market, the broker can save you hours of wasted driving-around time. When it's time to make an offer on a home, the broker can point out ways to structure your deal to save you money.

If you haven't found a Real Estate Broker, please contact our office and we will be happy to introduce you to one!

campaign: CE: First Time Home Buyers - Mortgage Process
html:
• English (Default)
  • Spanish

Dear John and Doe,

That depends on a number of factors, including the cost of the house and the type of mortgage you get. In general, you need to come up with enough money to cover three costs:

Earnest money - the deposit you make on the home when you submit your offer, to prove to the seller that you are serious about wanting to buy the house. When you make an offer on a home, your real estate broker will put your earnest money into an escrow account. If the offer is accepted, your earnest money will be applied to the down payment or closing costs. If your offer is not accepted, your money will be returned to you. The amount of your earnest money varies.

Down payment - a percentage of the cost of the home that you must pay when you go to settlement. The more money you can put into your down payment, the lower your mortgage payments will be. Some types of loans require 5-20% of the purchase price.

Closing costs - the costs associated with processing the paperwork to buy a house. Closing costs - which you will pay at settlement - average 3-4% of the price of your home. These costs cover various fees your lender charges and other processing expenses. When you apply for your loan, we will provide you with the estimate of the closing costs, so you won't be caught by surprise

Please let us know if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

David Young
CMO / Partner
Business Development & Strategic Growth

Estimado John and Doe,

Todo depende de varios factores, incluyendo el costo de la casa y el tipo de hipoteca que obtenga. En general, necesitará tener suficiente dinero para cubrir tres gastos:

Depósito de garantía – El depósito que hace en una casa cuando hace una oferta, para probar al vendedor que habla en serio acerca de querer comprar la casa. Cuando hace una oferta en una casa, su corredor de Bienes Raíces pondrá su depósito de garantía en una cuenta de garantía bloqueada. Si la oferta es aceptada, su depósito de garantía será aplicado al anticipo o costos de cierre. Si su oferta no es aceptada, su dinero será regresado a usted. La cantidad del depósito de garantía varía.

Anticipo – Un porcentaje del costo de la casa que debe pagar cuando llega a un acuerdo. Conforme ponga más dinero en el anticipo, más bajos serán sus pagos de hipoteca. Algunos tipos de préstamos requieren el 5-20% del precio de compra.

Costos de Cierre – Los costos asociados con el procesamiento de los documentos para comprar una casa. Costos de cierre – Que pagará cuando llegue al acuerdo – un aproximado de 3-4% del precio de su hogar. Estos costos cubren varias cuotas, sus cargos del prestamista y otros costos de procesamiento. Cuando aplica para el préstamo, le proveeremos con el estimado de los costos de cierre, para que no sea tomado por sorpresa.

Por favor háganos saber si tiene alguna pregunta.

Saludos,

David Young

html:
• English (Default)

Dear John and Doe,

Most loans have 4 parts:

- principal: the repayment of the amount you actually borrowed;
- interest: payment to the lender for the money you've borrowed;
- homeowners insurance: a monthly amount to insure the property against loss from fire, smoke, theft, and other hazards required by most lenders;
- property taxes: the annual city/county taxes assessed on your property, divided by the number of mortgage payments you make in a year.

Most loans are for 30 years, although 15 year loans are available, too. During the life of the loan, you'll pay far more in interest than you will in principal - sometimes two or three times more! Because of the way loans are structured, in the first years you'll be paying mostly interest in your monthly payments. In the final years, you'll be paying mostly principal.

Sincerely,

David Young

Estimado John and Doe,

La mayoría de los préstamos tienen 4 partes:

-Principal: El reembolso de la cantidad que tomó prestada;

-Interés: Pago al prestamista por la cantidad que tomó prestada;

-Seguro de Propietario: Una cantidad mensual para asegurar la propiedad contra pérdida por fuego, humo, robo, y otros peligros requeridos por la mayoría de los prestamistas;

-Impuestos de Propiedad: Los impuestos anuales de ciudad/condado de su propiedad, divididos por el número de pagos de hipoteca que hace en el año.

La mayoría de los préstamos son por 30 años, aunque otros por 15 años están disponibles también. Durante la vida del préstamo, pagará aún más en interés que en principal – ¡a veces dos o tres veces más! – Por la forma en la que los préstamos están estructurados, en los primeros años estará pagando casi la mayoría de interés en sus pagos mensuales. En los últimos años, estará pagando la mayoría de principal.

Saludos,

Dear John,

Here's an important tip about buying a house: most real estate agents won't even submit your offer unless you've been pre-approved. That's right – you could be willing to pay the listing price, but if you haven't spoken to a mortgage professional and made sure you can qualify for financing, real estate agents won't want to present your offer to the seller. They don't want to waste the time and take the house off the market only to find out you couldn't get approved.

Make sure your offer has a fair chance by being pre-approved for financing first. Don't let this simple step stand in the way of you buying your dream home.


If you'd like to get pre-approved before you make an offer on a house, you can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

Dear John,

If you're thinking about buying a house, you probably know your credit score. There are many free online services that will update you with your score monthly or even daily. With all this information readily available, you probably feel pretty confident that you'll get approved for a mortgage. 

But did you realize it's possible to have an excellent credit score but not have the credit necessary to get approved? It doesn't happen often, but you could have a 747 credit score and “thin” credit. Most lenders want to see that you have at least three tradelines (like a credit card or car loan) established for at least twenty four months. If you have new credit or only two trade lines, you might not be approved.

However, there are certain programs where you can still be approved even if you have thin credit.

If you have questions on your credit report and your eligibility for financing, please let me know. You can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

Estimado John,

Si está pensando comprar una casa, probablemente sepa su número de crédito. Hay muchos servicios en línea gratis que lo actualizarán sobre su número mensual o incluso diario. Con toda esta información a la mano, probablemente se sienta muy confiado de que lo aprobarán para la hipoteca.

Pero ¿sabía que es posible tener un número de crédito excelente pero no tener el crédito necesario para ser aprobado? No sucede a menudo, pero podría tener un número de 747 y un historial “delgado”. La mayoría de los prestadores quieren ver que tenga por lo menos tres líneas (como una tarjeta de crédito y un préstamo de automóvil) establecido por lo menos durante veinticuatro meses. Si tiene nuevo crédito o sólo dos líneas, puede que no lo aprueben.

Sin embargo, hay ciertos programas que aún pueden aprobarlo aunque tenga un crédito delgado. 

Si tiene preguntas sobre su reporte de crédito o su elegibilidad para financiar, por favor hágamelo saber. Puede llamarme al 310-954-7772 o respondiendo a este correo.

This email was just sent to John

Dear John,

I want to share some important information with you that can make the mortgage approval process faster and easier. 

When you apply for a loan, your lender will ask you for certain documents. Every borrower is different, but by and large, they will request documents to verify two years of income and two months of assets.

What if you can't find them? You have one W2 but can't find the previous one. You moved a few times and changed accountants. If you can't find it, you have to request it, which takes time.

You might also be missing certain bank statements, especially if the down payment is coming from multiple accounts.

The longer it takes you to get key documents, the longer it will take you to get approved.

Why is that important? When you sign a contract to buy your house, there's a clause that specifies when you'll have a mortgage commitment. You want to do everything possible to meet that deadline. Chances are the seller will give you an extension, but why put yourself in that position?

So put together a file (it doesn't need to be paper copies – you can store them electronically). It should include these items: two years of income documents (W2s if you are salaried; personal and business tax returns if you are self-employed); 2 recent consecutive pay stubs; and 2 months recent consecutive bank statements from all accounts you'll be using for down payment and closing costs.

Even after you put this file together, keep saving these documents until you close. You will be required to provide a current pay stub and bank statement prior to closing. 

If you have any questions on what documents you'll need to get approved, you 

can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

Estimado John,

Quiero compartir información importante con usted que puede que haga su proceso de aprobación para hipoteca más rápido y fácil.

Cuando aplica para un préstamo, el prestador pedirá documentos importantes. Todo deudor es diferente, pero la mayoría, pedirá documentos para verificar dos años de ingresos y dos meses de activos.

¿Qué pasa si no puede encontrarlos? Tiene una W2 pero no puede encontrar la anterior. Se ha mudado varias veces y cambiado contadores. Si no puede encontrarla, tendrá que pedirla, lo cual toma tiempo.

También puede que no tenga ciertos estados de cuenta del banco, especialmente si el anticipo viene de múltiples cuentas.

Mientras más tiempo tome encontrar los documentos, más tiempo tarda en aprobarlo.

¿Por qué esto es importante? Cuando firma un contrato para comprar una casa, hay una cláusula que especifica que tiene un compromiso de hipoteca. Quiere hacer todo lo posible por cumplir la fecha establecida. Puede ser que el vendedor le de una extensión, pero ¿por qué ponerse en esa posición?

Entonces junte un archivo (no tienen que ser copias de papel - puede ser electrónico). Debe incluir estos documentos: dos años de ingresos (W2s si es asalariado; declaraciones de impuestos personales y de negocios si es independiente); 2 cheques de salario consecutivos recientes; y 2 meses recientes consecutivos de estados de cuenta de bancos de todas las cuentas que se utilizarán para hacer el pago del anticipo y costos de cierre.

Incluso después de hacer este archivo, siga guardando los documentos hasta el cierre. Requerirá proveer un cheque de salario actual y un estado de cuenta antes del cierre.

This email was just sent to John

Dear John,

I don't know if you've been through the bidding process yet, but I wanted to share some important information with you about making an offer that will be accepted.

Let's say you find a house you like. You do your research on similar homes that have sold in the area, and you talk to your realtor, who tells you the house is fairly priced. You make an offer at the listing price. 

Your realtor tells you your bid was rejected. They went with another offer. She finds out that the other party bid the same exact price as you did. Why did they go with the other offer?

Because your offer said you needed to sell your current house before you bought the new house. You needed to get the money from your sale in order to put down 20% on the new house.

Most sellers don't want their sale contingent on you selling your house. Too many things can come up that would cause delays or even make you unable to close.

So what do you do? You find out if you qualify without selling first. There are some programs that will let you buy with just 5% down. Or you might be able to rent out your current house to offset the carrying costs. If you can carry both homes for a short period of time, you may qualify to buy without selling.

Then you'd be able to put in an offer without a condition that you sell your current home. 

If you'd like to find out about qualifying to buy a house when you still need to sell your current home, you can reach me at 310-954-7772 or by replying to this email.

Estimado John,

No sé si ya ha pasado por el proceso de ofertar, pero quería compartir alguna información importante con usted sobre hacer una oferta que será aceptada.

Digamos que encuentra una casa que le gusta. Investiga sobre otras casas similares que se han vendido en el área y habla con su agente, quien le dice que la casa tiene un buen precio. Usted hace una oferta al precio de venta.

Su agente le informa que su oferta fue rechazada. Aceptaron otra oferta. Ella se entera que la otra persona ofertó exactamente el mismo precio que usted. ¿Por qué aceptaron la otra oferta?

Porque su oferta decía que necesitaba vender su casa actual antes de comprar su nueva casa. Necesitaba obtener el dinero de su venta para poder poner el anticipo de 20% en su nueva casa.

La mayoría de los  vendedores no quieren depender de que usted venda su casa. Muchas cosas pueden salir mal que pueden causar retrasos o incluso que no sea capaz de cerrar el trato.

¿Qué debe hacer? Usted investiga si califica sin tener que vender primero. Hay algunos programas que le dejarán comprar con tan sólo 5% de anticipo. O tal vez pueda rentar su casa actual para disminuir los gastos. Si puede mantener ambas casas por un corto periodo de tiempo, puede calificar para comprar sin vender.

Entonces sería capaz de poner una oferta sin condiciones de vender su casa actual.

Si quiere saber si califica para comprar una casa cuando usted tiene que vender su casa actual, puede llamarme al 310-954-7772 o responda a este correo.

Dear John,

If you're thinking about refinancing to take cash out, you might want to run the numbers first to find out exactly how much you'll walk away with after closing costs. 

Some closing costs are unavoidable, like recording fees and escrows, but some fees can be reduced. With title insurance for example, you can usually get a lower rate if you've gotten title insurance within the past ten years. With appraisals, sometimes you don't need a new appraisal report – you may be able to have a drive by appraisal done instead. 

If you want to get a clear picture of how much money you'll end up with, ask me to run the numbers for you. 

Please contact me at 310-954-7772 or simply reply to this email.

Dear John,

Have you heard about the 2% rule for refinancing? Years ago, people said it only made sense to refinance if your new rate was at least 2% below the rate on your current mortgage. 

Well, times have changed. It may even make sense to refinance if you can get a rate that's just 1% below the rate you're paying right now. It all depends on how long you plan on holding the loan and what your closing costs are.

If you'd like to discuss whether or not it makes sense to refinance, please contact me at 310-954-7772 or simply reply to this email.

Loan Update:

Conditional Approval

Congratulations John and Doe, your loan application has been forwarded to our processing department. The loan processor assigned to your mortgage application will gather and verify the necessary documentation in preparation for an underwriting decision. Please note that during this time, verification requests may be sent to your employer, mortgage holder/landlord and/or lending institutions.

REMEMBER - It is very important that you do not make any large purchases or transfer assets between accounts during the time your mortgage application is in process, as it may affect the approval of your application.

Thank you for the opportunity to be of service. Please call if you have any questions or concerns.

Conditional Approval

Congratulations John and Doe, your loan application has been forwarded to our processing department. The loan processor assigned to your mortgage application will gather and verify the necessary documentation in preparation for an underwriting decision. Please note that during this time, verification requests may be sent to your employer, mortgage holder/landlord and/or lending institutions.

REMEMBER - It is very important that you do not make any large purchases or transfer assets between accounts during the time your mortgage application is in process, as it may affect the approval of your application.

Thank you for the opportunity to be of service. Please call if you have any questions or concerns.

Dear John and Doe,

I would like to take this opportunity to share some tips with you about keeping your home safe from fire. These simple tips can help keep your home safe and spare you from a needless tragedy:

  • Keep any plants or trees near your home well trimmed.
  • Keep a smoke detector in every bedroom and test them at least once a year.
  • Do not pile wood or store gardening supplies against your home.
  • In case of fire, make sure that every member of your family has an escape route and knows where to meet outside your home.
  • Keep a fire extinguisher in your kitchen and garage.
  • Keep space heaters at least 3 feet away from anything that may be flammable.
  • Never overload extension cords or run them underneath a rug.
  • Turn appliances and lights off when not in use.

I hope that you find these tips useful.

David Young

John and Doe,

Quisiera tomar esta oportunidad para compartir algunos consejos en cuanto a mantener su hogar libre del peligro de incendio.

Estos consejos sencillos pueden mantener a su hogar salvo y evitar una tragedia innecesaria:

  • Mantenga cualquier planta o árbol junto a su casa bien cortada.
  • Mantenga un detector de humo en cada dormitorio y pruebe las baterías por lo menos una vez al año.
  • No amontone madera o guarde herramientas de apoyadas en su casa.
  • En caso de incendio, asegúrese que cada miembro de su familia tenga una ruta de escape y sepa a dónde reunirse fuera de la casa.
  • Mantenga un extinguidor en su cocina y garaje.
  • Mantenga un distancia mínima de 3 pies entre un calenton portatil y cualquier cosa inflamable.
  • Jamás sobrecargue extensiones ni correrlos debajo de una alfombra.
  • Apague electrodomésticos y las luces cuando estén en uso.

Espero que estos consejos le sean útil.

Dear John and Doe,

I wanted to share some information with you on protecting your home from carbon monoxide poisoning. Carbon monoxide poisoning can be deadly. Leaks are typically odorless and not detected in time, most people do not realize the leak until they start to show symptoms of exposure.

The best way to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning is to make sure you have your appliances inspected annually. Furnaces and dryers tend to be the most common sources of CO2 in homes and should be inspected annually to ensure they are working properly.

In addition to professional annual checkups, periodically check your furnace. Look for these things:

  • Flames should be mostly blue and steady.
  • Look for discoloration or soot buildup around the burner access door and vents. This could signal a problem.
  • Check the venting system. Soft, rusted or broken vent piping can release combustion products indoors.
  • Examine the furnace or boiler. See that it's free of dust, rust or any other signs of corrosion.
  • Check air filters regularly. Clean or replace them as needed.
  • Make sure furnace panels and grill are in place and the fan compartment door is closed when the furnace is on. Leaving these doors open could cause CO to build up in living areas.

Installing a carbon monoxide detector in each level of your home is also a good way of detecting leaks once they occur. You can purchase a monitor at most home improvement stores.

I hope that you find these tips helpful and look forward to staying in touch with you.

David Young
CMO / Partner
Business Development & Strategic Growth
NMLS: 62043 | DRE: 01371572
 310-954-7772

John and Doe,

Quise compartir con usted alguna información en cuanto a proteger su hogar de envenenamiento por monóxido de carbono. El monóxido de carbono puede ser mortal. Fugas típicamente no tienen olor y no son detectadas a tiempo, la mayoría de la gente no se dan cuenta de una fuga hasta que muestren síntomas de ser expuesto

La mejor manera de prevenir el envenenamiento de monóxido de carbono es de asegurarse de inspeccionar sus electrodomésticos anualmente, Calentones y secadoras tienden a ser la fuente más común de CO en el hogar y deben inspeccionar anualmente para asegurarse que funcionen correctamente

Además de un examen anual profesional, periodicamente examine su calenton. Busque lo siguiente:

  • Las llamas deben ser azules y constantes
  • Busque decoloraciones o acumulacion de hollin alrededor de la puerta de acceso y ventilación. Esto puede señalar un problema.
  • Revise el sistema de ventilación. Ductos suaves, oxidados, o rotos pueden soltar productos combustibles al interior.
  • Revise el calenton de aire o agua, Mire si está libre de polvo, oxidación o cualquier otra señal de corrosión.
  • Examine the furnace or boiler. See that it's free of dust, rust or any other signs of corrosion.
  • Examine regularmente los filtros de aire, Limpie o reemplazarlos según sea necesario.
  • Asegúrese que los paneles de calentón y parilla estén en su lugar y que la puerta del compartimiento de abanico estén cerradas cuando el calenton esta prendido. Dejando estas puertas abiertas puedan causar la acumulacion de CO en areas de vivienda.

Instalando un detector de monóxido de carbono en cada nivel de su hogar es una buena manera de detectar fugas en cuanto que sucedan, Puede conseguir un detector en la mayoría de las tiendas de mejoras para el hogar.

Espero que estos consejos le sean útil y espero mantenernos en contacto.

David Young

Business Development & Strategic Growth

Dear John and Doe,

I wanted to take this moment to share some quick and inexpensive upgrades that you can make to increase your home's appeal:

  • Replacing the doorknobs in your home can update the look of each room in your home.
  • If you want to update the look of your interior, try painting a room or even single wall with a bold color.
  • If you want to update your kitchen without remodeling, try replacing the hardware on your cabinetry.
  • You can quickly update the look of your exterior by replacing your mailbox and painting your garage doors.

I hope you find these ideas useful for keeping your home looking modern and new without breaking your budget.

If you know of anyone who would benefit from my services, please let me know and I will be happy to contact them.

John and Doe,

Quise tomar este momento para compartir unos mejoramientos rápidos y baratas que puede hacer para aumentar el atractivo de su hogar:

  • Reemplazar las agarraderas de las puertas puede modernizar la apariencia de cada cuarto en su hogar.
  • Si quiere modernizar la apariencia de el interior, pinte un cuarto o solo una pared con un color fuerte.
  • Si quiere actualizar su cocina sin remodelar, trate de reemplazar la ferretera de los gabinetes.
  • Si quiere actualizar la apariencia del exterior puede reemplazar el buzón y pintar las puertas del garaje.

Espero que estos consejos le sean útil en mantener su casa con apariencia moderna sin romper el presupuesto.
